pages.text: Crossroads adds 4 different ores into the world.
Native Copper is very common, but is only found between y=50 & y=70. When broken, it gives 3 copper nuggets.

Normal Copper ore is also very common, and is only found below y=30. However, you'll need $(l:basics/copper_processing)infrastructure$() to make it into ingots, and until you have the $(l:basics/copper_processing)infrastructure$() the ores are useless.
Tin ore is about as rare as gold, and is only found below y=30. It can be smelted into a tin ingot. Mine any that you find.
Ruby ore is very rare, and is only found mixed in with quartz ore in the nether. It's only useful for magic.
Copper and tin can be made into blocks and nuggets with the normal recipe, and rubies can be made into blocks when crafted in a 2x2. Also, copper and tin can be combined to make bronze.

Salt isn't found naturally, but it is created later on. It can be turned into blocks that fall like sand.$(br2)The Salt Block kills plants nearby, turning grass into coarse dirt and plants into dead bushes. Creepers are considered a type of plant.$(br2)Salt also shrivels up slimes into slimeballs, with the number of slimeballs being based on slime size.
